description: Lists all available details about the instance fleets in a cluster.

parameters.name: ClusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

nested_items.name: InstanceFleets
nested_items.description: The list of instance fleets for the cluster and given filters.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A friendly name for the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: A code representing the instance fleet status.
PROVISIONING--The instance fleet is provisioning Amazon EC2 resources and is not yet ready to run jobs.
BOOTSTRAPPING--Amazon EC2 instances and other resources have been provisioned and the bootstrap actions specified for the instances are underway.
RUNNING--Amazon EC2 instances and other resources are running. They are either executing jobs or waiting to execute jobs.
RESIZING--A resize operation is underway. Amazon EC2 instances are either being added or removed.
SUSPENDED--A resize operation could not complete. Existing Amazon EC2 instances are running, but instances can't be added or removed.
TERMINATING--The instance fleet is terminating Amazon EC2 instances.
TERMINATED--The instance fleet is no longer active, and all Amazon EC2 instances have been terminated.

nested_items.name: StateChangeReason
nested_items.description: Provides status change reason details for the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: Code
nested_items.description: A code corresponding to the reason the state change occurred.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: An explanatory message.

nested_items.name: CreationDateTime
nested_items.description: The time and date the instance fleet was created.

nested_items.name: ReadyDateTime
nested_items.description: The time and date the instance fleet was ready to run jobs.

nested_items.name: EndDateTime
nested_items.description: The time and date the instance fleet terminated.

nested_items.name: InstanceFleetType
nested_items.description: The node type that the instance fleet hosts. Valid values are MASTER, CORE, or TASK.

nested_items.name: TargetOnDemandCapacity
nested_items.description: The target capacity of On-Demand units for the instance fleet, which determines how many On-Demand Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision On-Demand Instances as specified by  InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When an On-Demand Instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use  InstanceFleet$ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity to determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: TargetSpotCapacity
nested_items.description: The target capacity of Spot units for the instance fleet, which determines how many Spot Instances to provision. When the instance fleet launches, Amazon EMR tries to provision Spot Instances as specified by  InstanceTypeConfig. Each instance configuration has a specified WeightedCapacity. When a Spot instance is provisioned, the WeightedCapacity units count toward the target capacity. Amazon EMR provisions instances until the target capacity is totally fulfilled, even if this results in an overage. For example, if there are 2 units remaining to fulfill capacity, and Amazon EMR can only provision an instance with a WeightedCapacity of 5 units, the instance is provisioned, and the target capacity is exceeded by 3 units. You can use  InstanceFleet$ProvisionedSpotCapacity to determine the Spot capacity units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedOnDemandCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of On-Demand units that have been provisioned for the instance fleet to fulfill TargetOnDemandCapacity. This provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than TargetOnDemandCapacity.

nested_items.name: ProvisionedSpotCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of Spot units that have been provisioned for this instance fleet to fulfill TargetSpotCapacity. This provisioned capacity might be less than or greater than TargetSpotCapacity.

nested_items.name: InstanceTypeSpecifications
nested_items.description: An array of specifications for the instance types that comprise an instance fleet.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 instance type, for example m3.xlarge.

nested_items.name: WeightedCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units that a provisioned instance of this type provides toward fulfilling the target capacities defined in  InstanceFleetConfig. Capacity values represent performance characteristics such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If not specified, the default value is 1.

nested_items.name: BidPrice
nested_items.description: The bid price for each Amazon EC2 Spot Instance type as defined by InstanceType. Expressed in USD.

nested_items.name: BidPriceAsPercentageOfOnDemandPrice
nested_items.description: The bid price, as a percentage of On-Demand price, for each Amazon EC2 Spot Instance as defined by InstanceType. Expressed as a number (for example, 20 specifies 20%).

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: A configuration classification that applies when provisioning cluster instances, which can include configurations for applications and software bundled with Amazon EMR.

nested_items.name: Classification
nested_items.description: The classification within a configuration.

nested_items.name: Configurations
nested_items.description: A list of additional configurations to apply within a configuration object.

nested_items.name: Properties
nested_items.description: A set of properties specified within a configuration classification.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EbsBlockDevices
nested_items.description: The configuration of Amazon Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) attached to each instance as defined by InstanceType.

nested_items.name: VolumeSpecification
nested_items.description: EBS volume specifications such as volume type, IOPS, size (GiB) and throughput (MiB/s) that are requested for the EBS volume attached to an Amazon EC2 instance in the cluster.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. Volume types supported are gp3, gp2, io1, st1, sc1, and standard.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: SizeInGB
nested_items.description: The volume size, in gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024. If the volume type is EBS-optimized, the minimum value is 10.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput, in mebibyte per second (MiB/s). This optional parameter can be a number from 125 - 1000 and is valid only for gp3 volumes.

nested_items.name: Device
nested_items.description: The device name that is exposed to the instance, such as /dev/sdh.

nested_items.name: EbsOptimized
nested_items.description: Evaluates to TRUE when the specified InstanceType is EBS-optimized.

nested_items.name: CustomAmiId
nested_items.description: The custom AMI ID to use for the instance type.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority at which Amazon EMR launches the Amazon EC2 instances with this instance type. Priority starts at 0, which is the highest priority. Amazon EMR considers the highest priority first.

nested_items.name: LaunchSpecifications
nested_items.description: Describes the launch specification for an instance fleet.

nested_items.name: SpotSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch specification for Spot instances in the fleet, which determines the allocation strategy, defined duration, and provisioning timeout behavior.

nested_items.name: TimeoutDurationMinutes
nested_items.description: The Spot provisioning timeout period in minutes. If Spot Instances are not provisioned within this time period, the TimeOutAction is taken. Minimum value is 5 and maximum value is 1440. The timeout applies only during initial provisioning, when the cluster is first created.

nested_items.name: TimeoutAction
nested_items.description: The action to take when TargetSpotCapacity has not been fulfilled when the TimeoutDurationMinutes has expired; that is, when all Spot Instances could not be provisioned within the Spot provisioning timeout. Valid values are TERMINATE_CLUSTER and SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND. SWITCH_TO_ON_DEMAND specifies that if no Spot Instances are available, On-Demand Instances should be provisioned to fulfill any remaining Spot capacity.

nested_items.name: BlockDurationMinutes
nested_items.description: The defined duration for Spot Instances (also known as Spot blocks) in minutes. When specified, the Spot Instance does not terminate before the defined duration expires, and defined duration pricing for Spot Instances applies. Valid values are 60, 120, 180, 240, 300, or 360. The duration period starts as soon as a Spot Instance receives its instance ID. At the end of the duration, Amazon EC2 marks the Spot Instance for termination and provides a Spot Instance termination notice, which gives the instance a two-minute warning before it terminates.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: Specifies one of the following strategies to launch Spot Instance fleets: capacity-optimized, price-capacity-optimized, lowest-price, or diversified, and capacity-optimized-prioritized. For more information on the provisioning strategies, see Allocation strategies for Spot Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide for Linux Instances.

nested_items.name: OnDemandSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance fleet, which determines the allocation strategy and capacity reservation options.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: Specifies the strategy to use in launching On-Demand instance fleets. Available options are lowest-price and prioritized. lowest-price specifies to launch the instances with the lowest price first, and prioritized specifies that Amazon EMR should launch the instances with the highest priority first. The default is lowest-price.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationOptions
nested_items.description: The launch specification for On-Demand instances in the instance fleet, which determines the allocation strategy.

nested_items.name: UsageStrategy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible preferences include:
open - The instance can run in any open Capacity Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform, Availability Zone).
none - The instance avoids running in a Capacity Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an On-Demand Instance.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the instance.

nested_items.name: ResizeSpecifications
nested_items.description: The resize specification for the instance fleet.

nested_items.name: SpotResizeSpecification
nested_items.description: The resize specification for Spot Instances in the instance fleet, which contains the allocation strategy and the resize timeout period.

nested_items.name: TimeoutDurationMinutes
nested_items.description: Spot resize timeout in minutes. If Spot Instances are not provisioned within this time, the resize workflow will stop provisioning of Spot instances. Minimum value is 5 minutes and maximum value is 10,080 minutes (7 days). The timeout applies to all resize workflows on the Instance Fleet. The resize could be triggered by Amazon EMR Managed Scaling or by the customer (via Amazon EMR Console, Amazon EMR CLI modify-instance-fleet or Amazon EMR SDK ModifyInstanceFleet API) or by Amazon EMR due to Amazon EC2 Spot Reclamation.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: Specifies the allocation strategy to use to launch Spot instances during a resize. If you run Amazon EMR releases 6.9.0 or higher, the default is price-capacity-optimized. If you run Amazon EMR releases 6.8.0 or lower, the default is capacity-optimized.

nested_items.name: OnDemandResizeSpecification
nested_items.description: The resize specification for On-Demand Instances in the instance fleet, which contains the allocation strategy, capacity reservation options, and the resize timeout period.

nested_items.name: TimeoutDurationMinutes
nested_items.description: On-Demand resize timeout in minutes. If On-Demand Instances are not provisioned within this time, the resize workflow stops. The minimum value is 5 minutes, and the maximum value is 10,080 minutes (7 days). The timeout applies to all resize workflows on the Instance Fleet. The resize could be triggered by Amazon EMR Managed Scaling or by the customer (via Amazon EMR Console, Amazon EMR CLI modify-instance-fleet or Amazon EMR SDK ModifyInstanceFleet API) or by Amazon EMR due to Amazon EC2 Spot Reclamation.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: Specifies the allocation strategy to use to launch On-Demand instances during a resize. The default is lowest-price.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationOptions
nested_items.description: Describes the strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: UsageStrategy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationPreference
nested_items.description: Indicates the instance's Capacity Reservation preferences. Possible preferences include:
open - The instance can run in any open Capacity Reservation that has matching attributes (instance type, platform, Availability Zone).
none - The instance avoids running in a Capacity Reservation even if one is available. The instance runs as an On-Demand Instance.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationResourceGroupArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Capacity Reservation resource group in which to run the instance.

nested_items.name: Context
nested_items.description: Reserved.

nested_items.name: Marker
nested_items.description: The pagination token that indicates the next set of results to retrieve.
